definition: to torture sb using electricity/electrocution (capital punishment)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: If being ugly were a crime, you'd get the electric chair.
sentences.chinese: 如果长得丑是一种罪的话，那你就应该被电刑处死。
这个杀人犯被施以电刑。

sentences.english: The electrocute and disintegrate videos show it pretty well.
sentences.chinese: 瓦解之光和电刑的动画很好的显示了这一点。

sentences.english: On death row, General Krantz is led to the electric chair.
sentences.chinese: 在死刑房，“将军”被准备执行电刑。

sentences.english: That murderer was sentenced to burn.
sentences.chinese: 那名杀人犯被判处电刑。

sentences.english: People being electrocuted appear to experience pain.
sentences.chinese: 处以电刑的人看上去在经历着痛苦。

sentences.english: We give compassionate electrocution and compassionate lethal injection.
sentences.chinese: 我们实施的是仁慈的电刑和注射死亡。

sentences.english: Tennessee's rescinded manual appeared to confuse lethal injection with electrocution.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西废黜的手册似乎是将致命注射和电刑混为一谈。

definition: person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]

tiger bench (torture method in which the victim sits with legs extended horizontally along a bench, upper legs held down with straps while bricks are inserted under the feet, forcing the knee joint to bend in reverse)
to respond to an assault by killing one's assailant
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
